alert.note: Alert for Union (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:21AM CDT until April 05 at 4:30AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WEBSTER...NORTHWESTERN UNION...CLAIBORNE...NORTHERN BIENVILLE AND NORTHWESTERN LINCOLN PARISHES... At 320 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Junction City to near Gibsland to 10 miles west of Ringgold to 9 miles east of Stonewall, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Homer, Arcadia, Sibley, Gibsland, Dubberly, Heflin, Junction City, Athens, Lisbon, Spearsville, Lillie, Bryceland, Mount Lebanon, Plum Orchard Landing, Sailes, Lake Clairborne, Corinth, Ogden, Antioch and Taylorville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northwestern Louisiana. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for north central Louisiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
